content.description: Train A runs back and forth on an east-west section of railroad track. Train A's velocity, measured in meters per minute, is given by a differentiable function vA(t) , where time t is measured in minutes. Selected values for vA(t) are given in the table above.
content.question: Do the data in the table support the conclusion that train A's velocity is -100 meters per minute at some time t with 5 < t < 8 ? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: Do the data in the table support the conclusion that train A's velocity is -100 meters per minute at some time t with 5 < t < 8 ? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
